channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: 'AI assistants are no longer just productivity tools; they are becoming part of the infrastructure that malware can abuse': Experts warn Copilot and Grok can be hijacked to spread malware
item.description: Malware can blend in with legitimate AI traffic using popular AI tools as C2 infrastructure.

item.title: Dyson announces the PencilWash wet floor cleaner
item.description: Last year Dyson introduced the PencilVac, which it immediately declared the "world’s slimmest vacuum cleaner." Presumably, then, the title of world’s slimmest wet floor cleaner goes to the newly unveiled PencilWash. Promising a "lighter, slimmer and smaller solution to wet cleaning without compromising on hygiene," the PencilWash is designed to let you clean everywhere you need to with minimal hassle. Like the vacuum cleaner with which it shares the first part of its name, the handle measures just 1.5 inches in diameter from top to bottom, and the whole thing weighs little more than 2kg. The u...

item.title: Dyson turned its skinny PencilVac into a lightweight wet floor cleaner
item.description: Dyson has announced an alternate version of its skinny PencilVac that's designed to clean spills and stains on hard floors instead of sucking up dirt and debris. Like the PencilVac, which Dyson called "world's slimmest vacuum cleaner" when it was announced nine months ago, the new PencilWash squeezes a battery, motor, and other electronics into […]

item.title: Dyson dégaine un laveur de sol très compact pour nettoyer toutes les taches même sous les meubles
item.description: Voici le Dyson PencilWash, un nouveau laveur de sol qui mise sur un format compact et léger pour une grande maniabilité et une grosse promesse sur la propreté des sols.

item.title: Tom Noonan, Frankenstein of ‘The Monster Squad,’ Dies at 74
item.description: He also starred in 'Last Action Hero,' 'RoboCop 2,' 'Heat,' and 'Manhunter.'

item.title: A report details how much more expensive 130-inch TV screens are to produce than 115-inch screens — 27% larger screen for 50% higher price
item.description: Massive TVs mean massive price tags for early adopters if you're waiting for next-gen RGB TVs at projector-beating sizes

item.title: Etsy sells secondhand clothing marketplace Depop to eBay for $1.2B
item.description: The deal comes nearly five years after Etsy purchased Depop for $1.62 billion, at a time when secondhand clothing apps were gaining traction during the pandemic.

item.title: Meta is reportedly planning to launch a smartwatch this year
item.description: Meta is planning to launch a smartwatch with health tracking and AI features later this year, along with an updated version of its Meta Ray-Ban Display smart glasses, The Information reports. The smartwatch would arrive ahead of a pair of mixed reality glasses, code-named Phoenix, that Meta has reportedly delayed until 2027 amidst efforts to […]

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg Takes the Stand, No Meta Ray-Bans Allowed
item.description: At least two people accompanying Mark Zuckerberg to court on Wednesday wore the AI glasses.

item.title: Uber Is Sinking Over $100 Million Into Charging Stations for Self-Driving Cars
item.description: The move signals the ride-hailing company is preparing for the rise of robotaxis.

item.title: The Dream of Home Arcades Isn’t Dead, and Neither Is Arcade1Up
item.description: The company behind Lite Brite said it wants to make Arcade1Up feel even more authentic than before.

item.title: A New Moon Race Starts This Year—and This Time It’s All About the Water
item.description: The U.S. and China are each planning to land in the Moon’s Shackleton crater this year. Whoever gets there first will secure the best access to its resources.

item.title: AI is helping hackers make new malware faster and more complex than ever - and things may only get tougher
item.description: Social engineering is still the number one attack vector, but ransomware operators are stepping away from encryptors.

item.title: The best iPad deals you can get right now
item.description: While the best iPad deals usually land during major sale events like Black Friday, many great iPad deals are available outside of those times. The day-to-day discounts come and go like changing winds, so there’s often some amount to be saved, particularly on Apple’s most affordable iPad, the iPad Mini, and the latest iPad Air. Hell, […]

item.title: Utah Governor Pushes Back on CFTC’s Prediction Market Power Grab
item.description: The Trump administration is going to bat for a hands-off approach to the explosion of gambling in America.

item.title: Hacking conference Def Con bans three people linked to Epstein
item.description: The Def Con hacking conference banned hackers Pablos Holman and Vincenzo Iozzo, as well as former MIT Media Lab director Joichi Ito, from attending the annual conference after their reported connections with Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Essential Embo Episodes to Watch Before ‘The Mandalorian and Grogu’
item.description: With the iconic 'Clone Wars' bounty hunter making his live-action debut in the new 'Star Wars' movie, we look back at the must-watch episodes from his clearly very important back catalogue.

item.title: ‘Unbeatable hardware heist’: Get a free Asus TUF Gaming X870E-Plus AM5 motherboard when you buy 32GB V-Color Manta DDR5 memory for $449.99
item.description: Save a staggering 45% off the prices of the two components sold separately, it’s another bonkers deal!

item.title: Farewell, old friend — Linux 7.0 finally ditches the ancient (but iconic) Intel 440BX chipset's EDAC driver, but what's next?
item.description: Linux kernel 7.0 removes the Intel 440BX EDAC driver, ending legacy support while highlighting the shift toward modern memory and CPU architectures.
